title.narrative: OUTPUT 3.3: Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) EMERGENCIES

description.narrative: Populations affected by humanitarian crises and epidemics By 2024, access timely, accountable and equitable Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) services., which contributes to Climate Change, Disaster Risks And Envionmental Degradation, Climate Change, Disaster Risks And Envionmental Degradation (Covid), Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices, Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices (Covid), Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities, Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2024, children and their families in selected rural and urban areas, including in humanitarian settings, live in a climate- resilient environment and use safe and sustainable water, sanitation and hygiene (WASH) services.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Populations affected by humanitarian crises and epidemics By 2024, access timely, accountable and equitable WASH services.

description.narrative: The reporting year was challenging with the eruption of the Nyiragongo volcano in May, the various impacts of Climate Change like flooding in Kalemie and South Kivu, the influx of CAR refugees, the declaration of a new epidemic of Ebola in Butembo (12th) and Beni (13th) and the persistence of COVID-19, Cholera and Malaria with consecutive waves of infections. The humanitarian context remained marked by complex and continuous crises of displacement of populations due to armed conflicts in the region of Ituri, Tanganyika and both Kivus. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:27/12/2021
